De Fabriek.title: Emigré
De Fabriek.about: De Fabriek Teams up with Ausland (Roberto Auser) for this wonderful journey. It's an album that travels the globe in search for a common language, only to find a Babylonian Confusion of Tongues..
De Fabriek.credits:
released September 6, 2024
            
            This time De Fabriek is joined by Harold Schellinx, Haraldur Ingi Haraldsson (who also did the voice on 'Noordkant' from 'Neveleiland') and the usual suspects Richard van Dellen, Martijn Hohmann and Peter Ehrmann.



Roberto Auser composed the initial music, Haraldur Ingi Haraldsson recited islandic poems and prose. De Fabriek members reworked all material into the story of Emigré..



Mixed by Martijn Hohmann and Richard van Dellen, Design by Martijn Hohmann

De Fabriek.title: Meelkop - Hohmann
De Fabriek.about:
Collaboration album by Martijn Hohmann and Roel Meelkop.



Spring 2023 Martijn and Roel ran into each other at an Asmus Tietchens gig in Rotterdam after which they exchanged some of their releases. Later, Roel suggested to do a collaboration. A few months after that Martijn sent Roel a bunch of new tracks / recordings. Roel edited these recordings and added his own material.
De Fabriek.credits:
released September 15, 2024
            
            All music by Martijn Hohmann and Roel Meelkop. 

Design by Universaalkunst.



Roel Meelkop (1963) studied visual arts and art theory at the Willem de Kooning Academy in Rotterdam, The Netherlands. During a post-graduate course at the same academy he decided to dedicate his work to sound and music. His musical activities date back to the early eighties when he started post-industrial project THU20, together with Jac van Bussel, Peter Duimelinks, Jos Smolders and Guido Doesborg.

Their working method included many discussions about how to compose and why. This period was crucial in forming his ideas and concepts about sound and how to organise it, but it was not until the mid nineties that he was able to fully realise these ideas. The purchase of a sampler and later a computer radically changed his possibilities of working with sound, offering infinitely more control and freedom.

Since then he has worked steadily on a body of sound work, most of which was recieved enthusiastically in the small but dedicated world of sound art. His other activities include working with Kapotte Muziek and GOEM, together with Frans de Waard and Peter Duimelinks, and organising sound events, mostly in Rotterdam.





Martijn Hohmann (1968) is active in design, graphic arts, installation and soundart/composition. He has been releasing his music since 2006, mostly in elaborate art packaging, under his own Universaalkunst label.

Since 2017 he has been a steady member of De Fabriek

De Fabriek.title: Krautsalat
De Fabriek.about:
Bij de naam De Fabriek komen automatisch twee zaken bij mij boven: Zwolle en The Residents. Toen dit het gezelschap in 1977 voor het eerst van zich liet horen bestond internet niet. In die tijd liet De Fabriek op al hun uitgaven hun adres in Zwolle achter. Eerst was dat de Van der Laenstraat maar vrij snel werd dat de Molenweg en nog later de Heemskerckstraat. Na al die tijd is hun hoofdzetel nog steeds in Zwolle. The Residents zijn de geheimzinnige act uit San Francisco die het experiment niet schuwen en waarvan niemand weet wie het zijn. 



Beides gilt auch für De Fabriek, das am besten als ein Kollektiv beschrieben werden kann. Bei jeder Veröffentlichung werden die beteiligten Musiker ordentlich aufgelistet, aber ob sie alle auch wirklich existieren, ist nicht immer klar. Auf De Fabriek-Produkten gibt es nie Fotos von einzelnen Personen. Auf seltenen Pressefotos sind meistens nur zwei oder drei Männer zu sehen, die immer Masken tragen. Im Laufe der Zeit ist die Identität einiger Kernmitglieder deutlich klarer geworden. Richard Van Dellen leitet seit 1977 das Hauptquartier in Zwolle und ist unter anderem für Kommunikation und Werbung verantwortlich. Das andere Büro wird seit mehreren Jahren von Martijn Hohmann aus Breda verwaltet, der unter anderem für das Design verantwortlich ist. Darüber hinaus gibt es immer andere, verschiedene Musiker und Künstler, die sich als Mitarbeiter bei De Fabriek anschließen.



For their first CD release of 2025, De Fabriek plunges itself into the music of its German nextdoor neighbors. On Krautsalat, the Kraut theme suddenly becomes very prominent. Kraut can occasionally be heard in many of their previous productions. But this is an entire album filled with Krautrock! Made using De Fabriek’s characteristic working method: in collaboration with other musicians. The refined design is a big nod to a piece of German cultural history. Ken uw Klassiekers!



(original text by Oscar Smit)



Dit project kwam tot stand, zoals zo vaak gebeurt, door toeval. Het idee ontstond in de zomer van 2024 onder het genot van een wijntje op een terras in Griekenland. We wilden iets doen met het thema Kraut. Een goede kennis bracht ons in contact met Steve Schroyder (Tangerine Dream, Ash Ra Temple) Steve bood aan om nog ongebruikte muziek uit 1972 van zijn toenmalige band Scarecrew te gebruiken. Daarnaast wilden we al langer iets doen met de muziek van Tonspur (Mekanik Kommando, The Use Of Ashes) die een vorm van hedendaagse Kraut maken. Door als laatste de broers Chulkov (Six dead Bulgarians) daar nog aan toe te voegen was het verhaal compleet. Zo ontstond een verassende salade.



De Fabriek Records and Tapes 2025 FABPROD032
De Fabriek.credits:
released April 12, 2025
            
            Mitarbeiter: Steve Schroyder, Richard van Dellen, John Living, Peter van Vliet, Chris Eller, Martijn Hohmann, Chandor Gloomy, Gene Gross, Simon van Vliet, Ramamurtie Gresbek, Alexander Chulkov, Rafael Schulz, Aleksey Chulkov, Ray Steeg.



Opgenomen 1972-2024: Dieter Dierks Studio Berlin, Tempel Studio Nijmegen, Fab Studio Zwolle.

Met dank aan: Karl Waldschütz, Louise Nanuru, Nynke Bijlsma en Oscar Smit.

De Fabriek.title: Operation Geboise Bleue
De Fabriek.about:
In february 1960 the first ever French nuclear test was performed above ground in the desert of Regane in, then occupied, Algeria. It was codenamed ‘Le Gerboise Bleue’ and made France the 4th nuclear power worldwide. It’s 70 Kiloton yield was more then three times as powerfull as the Nagasaki bomb. The following two tests were named ‘Rouge’ and ‘Blanc’ in line with the Fench three-colour flag. After the tests, nuclear fallout was detected as far away as Senegal, Ivory Coast and Sudan. 

In february 2022 large parts of Europe were covered in orange dust. It was blown in from the Sahara desert which was mainly visible in skiing areas. Analyses carried out by ACRO showed that they contain residues of radioactive Caesium-137 pollution, originating from the French nucelar testing in the Algerian desert.

During that same february in ‘22, for the first time in decades, Russia threatened with nuclear action during the start of the Ukraine war.



The initial recordings for this album were made more than twenty years ago by Nocturne and De Fabriek but it never materialised into a release. The recent february events made us revive this project. The cassette tape holds the unreleased recordings by De Fabriek and Nocturne from 20 years ago. The CD contains new music by De Fabriek.
De Fabriek.credits:
released June 29, 2022
            
            Music by Richard van Dellen, Saphi, Berry ‘Echo’ Rikkerink,

Bob ter Hofte, Peter Ehrmann and Martijn Hohmann.

De Fabriek.title: Ik Besta
De Fabriek.artist: Ausland  X De Fabriek met Har$
De Fabriek.about:
A supplement to Emigré, by Ausland X De Fabriek. 

defabriek.bandcamp.com/album/emigr



 Tracks composed, mixed and edited by Harold Schellinx over the years 2022 and 2023 using basic music tracks composed and recorded by Derk Reneman (Ausland). All except ‘Blauwe vinnen’ and ‘De kloeke atoomraket’ eventually became part of the story that is told on ‘Emigré’. 

In ‘Ik Besta‘ the texts written by Har$ weave a somewhat different story, that can be read along in several languages—on the limited K7-edition on a set of 26 cards packed in a cassette-case, online by clicking the ‘lyrics’ links. All texts are based on Schellinx‘ (unpublished Dutch) novel ‘Ik Besta’. The voices reciting and at times singing the texts are that of (Japanese) Yoko Miura, (Mandarin) Yungwei Chen, (Dutch) Gersande Schellinx & Har$.



More info:  www.harsmedia.com/SoundBlog/Archief/00905.php
De Fabriek.credits: released December 1, 2024

trackinfo.title: Puree
trackinfo.lyrics:
(Japanese)

粗野な乱暴者が
筋肉もりもりの息子と一緒に
私のアパートに押し入ってきた
彼らは、私にじゃがいもを買えと言い、
袋から、生煮えのマッシュポテトくを取り出し、台所のなべにほうり込んだ 
 
NO! NO! NO!
私は彼らに言った
私は　あんたのジャガイモはいらない
GO! GO! GO!
今すぐ出て行って！！
  
彼のマッチョな息子は　私を乱暴に突き飛ばした
警察を呼ぶわよ、と電話に手を伸ばしたが、恐怖で手が震え思うようにつかめない
  
その時目に入ったTIME KEEPER’S DEVICE
ブーメランのような形の黒いプラスチックのくさび
表面に白く書かれたFatherという文字
真ん中にボタンがひとつ
  
私がボタンを押すとアラームが鳴りひびき、
ひしゃげた爆音が炸裂する
Pop Musicが繰り返し流れる
何度も何度も　より強力に
何度も　何度も　何度も
無限ループで繰り返す
おわりのない音楽の回転
  
でもだれも答えない
  
NO! NO! NO!
だから言ってるでしょ
私は　あんたのジャガイモはいらない
GO! GO! GO!
今すぐ出て行って！！
  
でもだれも答えない

(Dutch)
Een bijzonder onbeschofte man kwam mijn appartement binnenstappen, samen met zijn afschrikwekkend gespierde zoon.  Ze wilden dat ik hun aardappelen kocht.  Ze goten ze grijzend uit hun tas in de pan die ik toevallig vasthield.  Maar de aardappelen waren al gekookt, het is een soort puree. Ze zeiden dat ik er zoveel kon krijgen als ik wilde, voor maar 95 cent. Maar mijn pan was maar een pannetje. Niks bijna kon daar in. De puree zag er walgelijk uit. Het verpeste goedje stonk, bedorven, en was gedept in een zwarte hellesaus. Dus ik zei hen, nee, nee, nee! Ik wil uw aardappel niet! U moet nu gelijk vertrekken! De zoon met de ferme spierbundels begon aan me te duwen. Ik zei hem dat-ie stoppen moest, dat ik de politie zou bellen. Ik haalde mijn mobieltje tevoorschijn. Maar het was niet echt een mobieltje. Het was een driehoekig zwart plastic ding dat leek op een boemerang. Een tijdhouder. Het had maar één knop, waarop in witte letters het woord 'Vader' stond. Ik zei hen, nee, nee, nee! Ik wil uw aardappel niet! U moet nu gelijk vertrekken! Ik drukte op de knop. De beltoon was een loopje met vervormde popmuziek, dat zich almaar door herhaalde. Over en over en over. Dat zich almaar door herhaalde. Maar niemand nam op. Ik zei hen, nee, nee, nee! Ik wil uw aardappel niet!  U moet nu gelijk vertrekken! En niemand nam er op.

trackinfo.title: Jamais
trackinfo.lyrics:
(Mandarin)
當我從一側看窗外時，我看到了白色的花朵。 另一邊的窗外，花朵是紫色的。 因為無論你從窗戶往哪裡看，你總能看到鮮花。
威士忌很便宜，因為酒類商店不計算押金。 背面的標籤上寫著 dédié——但 à quoi 或 à qui，難以辨認。 我自己在沒有許可證的情況下出售裝在塑料罐中的洗滌劑。 上癮的客戶在一輛老式黑色美國汽車的後座用比特幣支付給我，這是一個年輕的阿拉伯人魯莽地高速開著。
它讓我感到噁心，從敞開的側門滾到鵝卵石上。 我在黑暗中走回家，傍晚的天空中有一個紅色的球體。 是火星嗎？ “在這個時候它移動得更快，在其他季節它會變慢，”我想。 家裡的客廳裡，所有的樂器又被蓋上了。 音樂家已經走了。 這就是為什麼我用荷蘭語大聲說出沒人聽得懂的話。

當我從花園裡出來的時候，有一張桌子上擺滿了蛋糕，還有一些是生奶油。 一個願意的女服務員給了我一個點，但它沒有。 她問我是否照顧好我的喉部。 我說：Jamais！希望她會離開，我可以得到一塊帶有生奶油的餡餅。她笑著扔了一個紅色橡膠球。我把那個球擊回了她的方向，並且順利地移動了，她轉身把那東西扔向對面的樹，當沙沙聲和喋喋不休的聲音慢慢開始時，它就被樹葉纏住了。

我現在等不及了。


(Dutch)
Als ik aan de ene zijde uit het raam kijk zie ik witte bloemen. Uit het raam aan de andere kant zijn de bloemen paars. Want waar je ook hier maar uit de ramen staart, altijd zie je bloemen. 
De whisky was goedkoop, omdat de drankwinkel het statiegeld niet telde. Het etiketje achterop vermeldde dédié—maar à quoi of à qui, dat was onleesbaar. Zelf verkocht ik wasmiddelen in plastic potten, zonder vergunning. Verslaafde cliënten betaalden mij in bitcoins, op de achterbank van een oude zwarte Amerikaanse slee, waarmee een jonge Arabier roekeloos en op hoge snelheid in de rondte reed. 

Ik word er kotsmisselijk van, en rol me uit de open zijdeur de kinderkopjes op. In het donker loop ik naar huis, met aan de avondhemel een rode bol. Is het Mars? “In deze tijd beweegt hij sneller, in andere jaargetijden zal het dan wel langzamer gaan,” bedenk ik. Thuis in de woonkamer liggen alle instrumenten weer onder doeken. De muzikanten zijn al weg. Op luide toon zeg daarom ik dingen in het Nederlands, die niemand kan verstaan.

Als ik buiten in de tuin kom, staat daar een tafel vol taart, sommige stukken mét slagroom. Een gewillig dienstertje geeft me een punt, maar die is zonder. Zij vraagt of ik wel goed op mijn strottenhoofd pas. Ik zeg jamais ! in de hoop dat ze dan weggaat, en ik een stuk van de taart mét slagroom pakken kan. Ze lacht en gooit een balletje op, van rode rubber. Ik sla die bal terug haar kant op. In één vloeiende beweging draait ze zich om en slingert het ding in de richting van de boom aan de overkant. Daar raakt hij in het gebladerte verstrikt, terwijl langzaam het geritsel en geratel er op gang komt.

Lang kan ik nu niet meer wachten.

trackinfo.title: Politics of a dream
trackinfo.lyrics:
« Les français sont tous jeunes, parce que tu sais pourquoi ? Sont pas des alphabets. Faut aller à l’école. Les africains : amenez les enfants à l’école, Pour que y est tous comme les français. Mais tous au maçonnerie. Les travail plus dur, les égouts… Tout ça, quand tu vois ça, c'est alphabets. Si tu n'as pas l’expérience, tu ne peux faire le métro, la force, ne peux pas faire le métro. C’est l'expérience qui fait le métro ! S'il vous plaît. Ho ! Les travaux forcés, c'est fini. On n'est plus au dixième siècle. Aidez-vous, amenez les enfants à l’école. S'il vous plaît. Macron il est là pour l’intérêt français, moi je le souhaite longue vie
C'est nous le problème ! … Solidarité ! … Je le souhaite longue vie, car il est là pour le bien. Mais Macky Sall je le souhaite le mort demain ! Sept personnes dans une chambre, ce n’est par normal ! »

trackinfo.title: Blauwe Vinnen (voorspel)
trackinfo.lyrics:
Wit met blauwe vinnen
Maar nog net niet binnen.
Wit met blauwe vinnen
Met blauwe vinnen
Wit
Wit
Wit

Een kloeke atoomraket,

over het perkje tot onder
het raam van mijn rijtjeshuis.

trackinfo.title: Game of Enigma (5 haiku's)
trackinfo.lyrics:
(Japanese)
仮面たちは
タイムホルダーの回転する球体の中で
欺瞞のかぎりをつくす
 
そのルーティーンから飛び出したあなた
あなたの鋭いまなざしは　何も語らない
謎解きゲーム
 
孤独なピアノ
隣人たちと遊離した
孤高の響き

Hey！！
暗闇が消えるまで
あなたの音をそこに響かせて
 
 
あなたのかすかなピアノの音で
世界の無上の喜びを引き出してよ

(Dutch)
We dragen maskers in de tijdhouder alles
draait om overlist.

Buurvrouw komt buiten
Ze loenst en dat zegt me niks
Spel van mysterie

De piano staat
voor de helft bij de buren
en is daar alleen

Doe het dan buurvrouw
Laat muziek nu verklinken
Dat donker verdwijnt

Sla je piano Voor de wereld onhoorbaar Oneindig plezier

trackinfo.title: J'existe
trackinfo.lyrics:

I believe
I am
There is
No-one but me
I care for me
I have faith
In me
I trust
me
I have
me
and do it
I do no wrong
I trust 
me

Do you
need words
of affirmation?

(Dutch)
Ik ben
geloof ik
mezelf 
Ik besta
Er is niemand anders 
dan ik 
Ik voed en zorg 
voor mezelf 
Ik heb een standvastig geloof 
in mezelf

in mezelf
Ik bezit 
mezelf 
En ik onderneem 
met overtuiging 

Geen vlieg 
doe ik kwaad 
Heb jij 
woorden nodig 
die dat bevestigen?

trackinfo.title: De Kloeke Atoomraket, in het Westen
trackinfo.lyrics:
Een kloeke atoomraket, 
wit met blauwe vinnen,
landde met een schuiver
over het perkje tot onder
het raam van mijn rijtjeshuis.

REFREIN:
Wit met blauwe vinnen
Maar nog net niet binnen.

Tot ontploffing kwam het niet,
als een kar, een bling,
een American ding, 
dat weer heel snel vertrekt,
zonder taal en zonder teken.

Op de Albert Cuyp werd
het middenschip gebouwd,
met veel bruine baksteen.
Maar dat stortte ’s nachts
weer in, met felle brand

REFREIN:
Wit met blauwe vinnen
Maar nog steeds niet binnen.

Als ik aan het knopje kom
gaan alle lichten aan,
ik moet dat peertje naast mijn hoofd
heel losjes in de fitting draaien

REFREIN:
Wit met blauwe vinnen
Maar nog nooit niet binnen.

De Fabriek.title: Rovelatous Dans Le Fabrique
De Fabriek.about:
Reissue by EE Tapes of our limited cassette from 1996.

A coöperation between Matthias Lang (Irre Tapes, Germany) and De Fabriek.



This is the 3rd and last special release for the 35th anniversary of EE Tapes!



The history for this release goes back quite a few years. First, there is the collaboration between De Fabriek and Mr Moto. If you have no idea who or what De Fabriek is, then you haven't been paying attention in the last years, but Mr Moto, that is a different story. I don't think I ever reviewed work by Matthias Lang, Mr Moto himself and head-honcho of Irre Tapes before. His story goes back to the 80s when he started his label. Oddly enough, I am sure I never heard much of the music he created. In 1996, he

recorded work with De Fabriek, released on cassette by Belgium's EE Tapes. They now re-release this cassette, on CD, in an edition of 100 copies. It is a bit unclear who is doing what on this cassette. I could hazard a guess, but then, I rather not. Bandcamp says they meet on neutral ground, implying shared responsibility in mixing and editing. In the wonderful tradition of De Fabriek, there is a lot of synthesizer music, building on that fine cosmic/kraut tradition which is a very core of De Fabriek, but this time with quite a few sequencers running amok. The music is more on the experimental side of the cosmic wall. None of these synthesizers bounces around in a neat arpeggio style. Maybe that is an artistic choice or something inherent to how they use their equipment (or the lack thereof!). There is some rudimentary sampling going on here, and that adds a very early 90s cassette vibe to the music. It is all a bit too long before something new kicks in or driving by just

insufficient sound sources. I enjoy this kind of thing a lot. Maybe it is the older man getting sentimental, reminding me of too many things (and too private for a review). Who knows? Great! (FdW, Vital Weekly aug. 2022)
De Fabriek.credits: released August 15, 2022

De Fabriek.title: The Hohmann Transfer
De Fabriek.about:
A free association between the various forms of leaving earth like traveling to the moon, losing one's consciousness or the end of life itself, with the Hohmann family name as a starting point and guiding theme.



Vital Weekly Review:

MARTIJN HOHMANN - THE HOHMANN TRANSFER (CD by De Fabriek Records & Tapes)



The first thing to notice here is this released by De Fabriek Records & Tapes, a label usually reserved for releases by De Fabriek, even when in ancient history they released music by Mark Lane, RTC, Gen Ken Montgomery and The Force Dimension. However, Hohmann belongs to the current rotating cast of members of De Fabriek and helps them out with the design of covers. So, that might explain this. Martijn Hohmann works as a visual and audio artist in Breda, The Netherlands,

and over the years he didn't release that much as a solo artist. His last one was a limited run 3"CDR, Yunus' (Vital Weekly 1114), which I enjoyed quite a bit, even when it was all way too brief. This time, Hohmann went to town. 'The Hohmann Transfer' is released in two editions. One is a standard digipack, with spot varnish and 'teacup' print inside, while the other is a box, about 7" sized and it contains bigger printed cards, "giant 840 x 960mm poster, an art print, a unique signed and numbered artwork and various undisclosed theme-related artefacts", which I am still not sure what they are. This is an edition of twenty-copies. The poster contains a map of the moon and that is what this release is about; transfers to the moon. The fateful mission of Apollo 10 and the death of Hohmann's father; both travel towards the moon, the end of life. And, it is also the end of the line of the name Hohmann, so I am told. What is not said here, on the cover or otherwise, is what kind of

instruments Hohmann is using. Before he was interested in using vinyl as sources, but I would think this is replaced by the use of synthesizers, modular, analogue or software-based (I am not the sort of expert to say anything sensible about that), along with found sound from NASA (well, duh!), field recordings and an ancient recording from 1860 of 'Au Claire De La Lune'. Throughout the music is slow and peaceful; it is like being a slow spaceship moving through a vast empty and dark night, destination moon, but maybe also destination unknown. It is heavy on the drone side but it is not exclusively just that. In 'Deemesterhede' there is some sort of pulse to be noted, next to crackles and drones, that reminded me of Pan Sonic and in 'Au Claire De Lune', lots static, vinyl crackles and transmissions. Sometimes the music is all-dark but, again, also not something that he does all over the place. 'Morphin' is a ray of light, despite the heavy-handed title. Here we have eight pieces,

sixty-three minutes of pure sonic bliss. If I had such a thing, this would be my pick of the week. (FdW)
De Fabriek.credits:
released May 1, 2020
            
            All compositions by Martijn Hohmann

Mastered by Jos Smolders at EARLabs Studios

Released by De Fabriek records and tapes in 2020 - FABPROD 25



All sounds recorded 2017 - 2019 except:

track 4: “Apollo cockpit recordings” recorded 1969 by NASA, digitized by the Houston Audio Control Room.

track 5 and 8: “sea and wind sounds” recorded late 20th century by Wim van Holstein.

track 8: “Au claire de la lune” recorded 1860 by Édouard-Léon Scott de Martinville, restored by First Sounds.

Reviews:

DE FABRIEK - APXHAIX (2CD by De Fabriek)



For more than thirty years, the amorphous Dutch group De Fabriek (“The Factory”) have been 

committed to two things: collaboration with artists from around the world, and resistance to 

consistency. I tend to think of De Fabriek as being similar to Doc Wör Mirran, in that they make 

whatever music they’re moved to make with whomever they want to make it with… one album 

may or may not sound like the others you’ve heard. The last De Fabriek album I listened to was 

an electronic industrial album of heavy synthetic beats and synthesizer noise. This one is the 

exact opposite. The 52 tracks are presented without an index so that each disc runs together into 

one track apiece. The material is notable for how sparse it is, and how deliberate the pacing; one 

track could contain just two or three elements, perhaps a baroque cello and a voice. Or a distant 

drone and some rainfall. Or a gently understated acoustic guitar pattern and an environmental 

recording, or a jaw harp and some light electronic processing, a folk song and piano. A track 

appears for a couple of minutes, then segues into the next. Voices are prominent on 

“APXHAIX” (which is Greek for “Archaic”), in multiple languages; I think I heard Dutch, Italian, 

English, maybe German, probably more than those… if I understood multiple languages, I might 

have gotten more out of these sections, but literal meaning might be secondary to sonic character. 

I chose to hear the words as musical elements instead of text. A very even pace persists across all 

two+ hours of the album; the effect is like listening to a late-night radio station with a DJ moving 

steadily between classical strings and stranger tape music but being careful not to shatter the 

overall hushed atmosphere. Frans actually described the album to me as being “like a DJ set”, 

and I think that’s accurate. It doesn’t seem necessary to take in everything on these two discs in a 

single sitting. The episodic nature of “APXHAIX” seems well-suited to being played in the 

background, the listener allowing it to shape the room’s ambience, dipping in and out when a 

particular passage grabs their attention. (HS)

Reviews:



DE FABRIEK - REMIXES VOL. 1 (CD by De Fabriek)



There is nothing much logical about the work of Dutch legends De Fabriek. But then, you don't 

become a legend by doing ordinary things. There is much mystery about De Fabriek, even when 

in the last two years there is a Bandcamp page and you can reach (some) members via e-mail. 

Their last double CD was a real CD, and so is Remixes Vol. 1. Now, before you wonder if 'Remixes 

1' is the beginning of a new thing; it is perhaps the end of something? In Vital Weekly 1035 we 

discussed 'Remixes Vol. 5' and after that other volumes not in any chronological order when they 

were released on CDR and this being De Fabriek, it is always confusing. Who remixes who or 

what? In this case, one P. Ehrmann, also known as Peter PET takes on a look at material submitted 

by K. Mons, A. Eker, P. van Vliet, F. de Waard, R. van Dellen, R. Hemmes and M. Hohmann, 

besides Ehrman. Some of these names you may have found on the earliest De Fabriek releases 

back in the late '70s. Throughout the many years, this 'group' (collective might be a better word) is 

active, they have shifted through numerous musical genres; from experimental to ambient to 

industrial; even pushing the boundaries of techno music. These days De Fabriek are perhaps at 

their most eclectic and it shows on a release like 'Remixes Vol. 1'. Here spacious electronic parts, 

ambient music if you will, sit next to more beat-driven music, if one doesn't want to use word 

techno, but there are surely some strong beats on this release. Voices are picked up from the 

ether and mixed at will; that, perhaps, adds to the notion of the krautrock roots of De Fabriek, 

which they also have. As such the music bounces freely all over the place and it should be no 

surprise that there is also room for an updated version of 'Kein Spass In Zwolle', their electro-

punk anthem of bored youth from 1977, but now in a robot voiced version. As before De Fabriek 

takes the listener on a journey, from the cosmos to the dance floor, occasionally visiting a chill-

out in space again and landing with a 4/4 rhythm in 'Gedane Zaken'. Excellent, as usual. (FdW)

trackinfo.title: Mijn Kamer Als Middelpunt Van Het Universum

DE FABRIEK 

defabriek.bandcamp.com

 De Fabriek (The Factory) hails from the Dutch City of Zwolle and started in december 1977 as a collective project.



M.NOMIZED

 mnomized.bandcamp.com

 M.Nomized, born in Paris in 1956. Musician, composer, author, singer, poet and graphic designer, he started in '72 with contemporary music and sound research.

Review in Vital Weekly:

DE FABRIEK - REMIX VOLUME 9 (CD by De Fabriek Records & Tapes)



Emerging from the 1980s cassette scene De Fabriek is still releasing subversive music. Recently De Fabriek, or constant member Richard van Dellen, has been

releasing a series of 'Remix' albums. These albums are born out of the same spirit of those early cassette releases and collaboration. De Fabriek is now up the ninth instalment of the Remix series, with the latest being the strongest and most cohesive to date. 

	The concept is simple, van Dellen has a revolving door of friend, collaborators and conspirators who send him tracks, samples and sound material. Van Dellen then mixes it all into something that makes him smile. ‘And now for something completely different’ kicks the album off. After an ident for Nova FM, including some wayward guitar from Neil Young, and some radio patter the song gets underway with massive beats, hypnotic samples and (trip)Hip-hop vibes. It is one of my sedate tracks on the album. This gives away to ‘In Mijn Dromen Part One’ that opens with lullaby chime before a vocal sample about aliens. ‘Tomita and the Gremlins’ is one of the standout tracks. It traverses bass culture with skittering

beats, glitchy vocal samples and the aforementioned basslines. In a way, it lives up to its name as the backing synths are as exquisite as a Tomita track and all the noise in the fore could very well be some gremlins having a catch-up. It also feels like peak Squarepusher, from his 90s abrasive output. ‘RamBam’ is full of delightful percussion riffs all stuttering over each other. The results are a hypnotic cacophonous deluge. As ‘RamBam’ progresses the skittering becomes more intense it reaches a peak, before mixing into the next track. 

	What ‘Remix Volume 9’ does incredibly well is that it offers a continuous wonky stream of musical consciousness for 73 minutes. As the songs flow into one another you are taken on a musical journey that incorporates cut and paste, bass culture, musique concrete, rock, and sound collages. The beauty of ‘Remix Volume 9’ is that you don’t actually know who is on each track. In all fairness that doesn’t matter as the music

speaks for itself. It is everything we’ve come to expect from De Frabriek and quite possibly a little bit more too.

trackinfo.title: And Now For Something Completely Different
